awards.description: THIS WORK PLAN CONTAINS 3 COMPONENTS: DEVELOPING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, ACCESS TRAINING FOR STAFF AND COMMUNICATE WITH THE COMMUNITY; IMPLEMENTATION OF SOLID WASTE ACTIVITIES TO RECYCLE AND REMOVE HAZADOUS WASTE FROM THE COMMUNITY; DEVELOP BASELINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PLAN AND PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE PROGRESSIVE ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT WILL STRENGTHEN THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION: EXPLORE A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS AND ISSUES WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENCOURAGE INVOLVEMENT IN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROJECTS. FOCUS ON THE PRIORITIES IN THE TRIBE'S EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP) AND CURRENT WORKPLAN. CONTINUE TO IMPROVE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS, TRAINING FOR STAFF, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION; TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SUSTAINABILITY.ACTIVITIES:THIS WORK PLAN CONTAINS TWO COMPONENTS. COMPONENT ONE IS FOCUSED ON CONTINUING TO DEVELOP CAPACITY TO MANAGE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS SUPPORTING THE EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN PRIORITIES. THEY WILL DEVELOP STAFF AND PROGRAM KNOWLEDGE THROUGH TRAINING AND CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE. THEY WILL BUILD POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND DOCUMENT BEST PRACTICES. COMPONENT TWO PRIORITIZES COMMUNITY OUTREACH THROUGH CLEAN-UP EVENTS THAT BUILD AWARENESS OF IMPROPERLY DISPOSED OF WASTE; AND WILL BUILD ON OTHER CLEAN-UP WORK TO BACK-HAUL HAZARDOUS AND RECYCLABLE ITEMS OUT OF THE COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED GRANT DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY GRANT REPORTING. DETAILED TRIP REPORTS WITH CERTIFICATES IF APPLICABLE. COPIES OF QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS SENT OUT TO THE COMMUNITY. SUMMARIES OF CLEAN-UP EVENTS, VOLUME COLLECTED, AND POUNDS OR VOLUME OF BACKHAULED ITEMS SHIPPED. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.
